{{knowledge objective
|Identifiant=OIC-047-17-A
|Item_parent=Follow-up of normal infants, children and adolescents. Screening for orthopaedic, visual, hearing and dental abnormalities. Compulsory health examinations. School medicine. Child mortality and morbidity
|Item_parent_short=Follow-up of normal infants, children and adolescents. Screening for orthopaedic, visual, hearing and dental abnormalities. Compulsory health examinations. School medicine. Child mortality and morbidity
|Rank=A
|Title=Know the definition of dental caries
|Description=None
|Rubric=Definition
|Contributors=
|Order=17}}

Caries is the destruction of tooth enamel and dentine, with the formation of a cavity. It is caused by bacteria naturally present in the mouth.

question.title: What is dental caries?
question.description: The destruction of tooth enamel and dentine, with the formation of a cavity. It is caused by bacteria naturally present in the mouth.

option_a.title: A bacterial infection of the tooth pulp
option_a.description: A condition where the tooth pulp is infected with bacteria

option_b.title: The destruction of tooth enamel and dentine, with the formation of a cavity
option_b.description: A condition where the tooth enamel and dentine are damaged, leading to a cavity

option_c.title: A type of tooth abscess
option_c.description: A pocket of pus that forms in the tooth

option_d.title: A condition caused by poor oral hygiene
option_d.description: A condition where the teeth are not properly cleaned, leading to damage

correct_option.title: B
correct_option.description: The correct letter of the correct option
